I had this same trouble with a previous build which was running before some
maintenance. 
It may be due to a missing rpm but I can't see which and didn't find any answer 
by googling: gtk rpms seems all to be present.
Testing with another application using SWT (azureus) I get the same error.
What version of GTK+ do you have installed (and what distribution)?

distribution: fedora core 2 upgraded on the fly from fedora core 1 which was 
upgraded from redhat 9 (with yum).

about gtk version:

googling deeper I found g_assert_warning is introduced in glib version 2.5.4.
Installed version is 2.4.8 so libswt-pi-gtk-3111.so could not get it.

I think there is a linking problem somewhere because I had libswt-pi-gtk-3106.so 
running fine with redhat 9 settings which certainly not used glib 2.5.4 and now 
exits on same error.

further investigating, I checked sharded libraries used:

on
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/platform-swt-home/faq.html?rev=HEAD#gtkstartup
I read:
<sic>
Q: What do I need to run SWT on linux gtk?
A: SWT requires the following gtk libraries with the specified versions or later:
For Eclipse 3.0:
 * Gtk 2.2.1-4
 * Atk 1.2.0-2
 * Glib 2.2.1-1
 * Pango 1.2.1-3
 * Freetype 2.1.3-6
</sic>

What may be wrong ??

I really can't remember in what circumstances this library get upgraded to 
this uncomplete state (glib should have been upgraded at same time to provide 
the missing references) and if warning about missing dependencies were raised 
at this time.
Anyway I can go on working again on my project with eclipse.

Since nothing was really fixed in this bug, I'm going to mark it as WORKSFORME
instead.
